item.title: 世界顶级金矿公司纽蒙特的成本达到十年来最高水平
item.description: 纽蒙特公司公布了至少九年来最高的季度成本，部分原因是其在澳大利亚最大金矿之一的运营。【原文：Newmont Corp. posted its highest quarterly costs in at least nine years, in part because of its operations at one of Australia’s largest gold mines.】

item.title: WeightWatchers 准备在几周内申请破产
item.description: 据知情人士透露，WW 国际公司在与大多数贷款人达成债务重组协议后，正准备在几周内申请破产。【原文：WW International Inc. is preparing to file for bankruptcy within weeks after reaching a debt-restructuring deal with a majority of its lenders, according to people with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 斗牛士公司计划减少钻井活动，到 2025 年中期减少一个钻井平台
item.description: 得克萨斯州页岩油公司 Matador Resources Co. 计划在今年年中之前减少九个钻井平台中的一个，以应对原油价格暴跌。【原文：Texas shale-oil company Matador Resources Co. plans to drop one of its nine drilling rigs by the middle of the year in response to plunging crude prices.】

item.title: 特朗普将签署旨在加强人工智能教育的行政令
item.description: 据一位白宫高级官员透露，唐纳德-特朗普总统将签署一项行政命令，以促进人工智能教育和劳动力培训，这凸显了人工智能技术的快速发展是政府工作的重中之重。【原文：President Donald Trump will sign an executive order to boost artificial intelligence education and workforce training, according to a senior White House official, highlighting a rapidly developing technology that is a top administration priority.】

item.title: 特朗普反转令交易员疲惫不堪，反弹也无济于事
item.description: 在其他任何时候，这都是股市下滑最严重时期即将结束的信号，华尔街各交易柜台都会发出买入信号。【原文：Any other time, it would have been a signal that the worst of the stock-market’s slide is nearing an end, one that would have set off buy signals at trading desks across Wall Street.】

item.title: 巴拿马考虑无需国会批准的矿山重启方案
item.description: 巴拿马总统何塞-劳尔-穆利诺（Jose Raul Mulino）表示，巴拿马政府正在研究无需国会批准即可重启该国旗舰铜矿的方案。【原文：Panama’s President Jose Raul Mulino said his government is studying options to restart the nation’s flagship copper mine without the need for congressional approval.】

item.title: 特朗普削弱日本经济前景，IMF敦促日本央行灵活应对紧缩政策
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）敦促日本央行在进行任何进一步的利率上调时应保持灵活性并依赖数据，因为美国的关税对经济造成了压力并增加了不确定性。【原文：The Bank of Japan should be flexible and data-dependent in proceeding with any further interest-rate hikes as US tariffs weigh on the economy and add to uncertainty, the International Monetary Fund urged.】

item.title: ServiceNow 展望未来，预示软件需求将持续增长
item.description: 服务诺公司（ServiceNow Inc.）对销售增长的展望超过了分析师的预期，这表明，即使在经济受到关税威胁的情况下，软件需求仍然具有弹性。【原文：ServiceNow Inc. gave an outlook for sales growth that topped analysts’ estimates, an indication that software demand remains resilient even as the economy reels from the threat of tariffs.】

item.title: AT&T 和 Verizon 将把手机资费成本转嫁给客户
item.description: 美国最大的两家无线运营商 AT&T 公司和威瑞森通信公司（Verizon Communications Inc.【原文：AT&T Inc. and Verizon Communications Inc., two of the biggest wireless carriers in the US, said they won’t absorb any forthcoming price hikes on mobile handsets if and when President Donald Trump’s global tariffs kick in — and that means customers could pay more for new cell phones.】

item.title: IBM 公布销售额超过预期，称 DOGE 签订 15 份合同
item.description: 国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines Corp. ）公布的季度收入和利润均好于预期，平息了投资者对关税和联邦成本削减造成经济混乱的担忧。【原文：International Business Machines Corp. reported better-than-expected quarterly revenue and profit, quieting investor fears of economic disruption from tariffs and federal cost cuts.】

item.title: 德州仪器在需求回升后作出乐观预测
item.description: 最大的模拟半导体制造商德州仪器公司（Texas Instruments Inc.【原文：Texas Instruments Inc., the biggest maker of analog semiconductors, gave a better-than-anticipated forecast for the current period after demand for industrial and automotive components improved.】

item.title: 外国国债拍卖竞标者未受关税风波影响
item.description: 美国财政部周三公布的数据显示，自特朗普政府 4 月 2 日公布其全面关税计划以来，美国长期国债的首次拍卖吸引了接近平均水平的外国买盘。【原文：The first auctions of long-term US government debt since the Trump administration unveiled its sweeping tariffs agenda on April 2 drew near-average levels of foreign buying, according to Treasury Department data released Wednesday.】

item.title: 芬兰削减所得税和公司税以促进经济增长
item.description: 芬兰政府公布了一项耗资 23 亿欧元（26 亿美元）的一揽子措施，以启动低迷经济中的增长和投资。【原文：Finland’s government unveiled a €2.3 billion ($2.6 billion) package of measures to kickstart growth and investment in the subdued economy.】

item.title: Jack in the Box 考虑出售 Del Taco 连锁餐厅
item.description: 知情人士透露，Jack in the Box 公司正在考虑出售其于 2022 年收购的快餐连锁店 Del Taco Restaurants。【原文：Jack in the Box Inc. is considering a potential sale of Del Taco Restaurants, the fast food chain it acquired in 2022, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 浏览器竞争对手称谷歌 Chrome 浏览器价值 "高达 500 亿美元以上
item.description: 竞争对手搜索引擎 DuckDuckGo 的首席执行官周三在司法部针对互联网巨头的反垄断审判中作证称，谷歌的 Chrome 浏览器可能以高达 500 亿美元的价格出售。【原文：Google’s Chrome web browser could be sold for as much as $50 billion, the chief executive officer of rival search engine DuckDuckGo testified Wednesday at the Justice Department’s antitrust trial against the internet giant.】

item.title: 特斯拉在奥斯汀进行测试，力争 6 月推出机器人出租车
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Tesla Inc. has expanded its testing of a ride-share app to employees in Austin, as the company pushes toward a June launch of an autonomous version of the service.】

item.title: 马来西亚制造卖家躲避关税的方法层出不穷
item.description: 网上商户收到大量可疑报价，以帮助他们避免支付美国对中国制造商品征收的关税。【原文：Online merchants are being inundated with suspicious offers to help avoid paying US tariffs on goods made in China.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚将在 5 月总统选举后出售下一笔欧洲债券
item.description: 罗马尼亚财政部长表示，罗马尼亚将等待5月份总统选举的结果和抑制欧盟最大预算赤字的新措施，然后再重返国际市场。【原文：Romania will wait for the outcome of the May presidential election and new measures curbing the European Union’s largest budget deficit before it returns to international markets, the country’s treasury chief said.】

item.title: 巴拉圭将关键利率维持在 6%，通胀前景稳定
item.description: 巴拉圭中央银行将基准利率维持在 6%不变，理由是长期通胀预期与目标一致。【原文：Paraguay’s central bank kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 6%, citing long-term inflation expectations that are aligned with the target.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织发布加快主权债务重组手册
item.description: 全球金融领袖周三推出了一份新兴市场债务重组蓝图，旨在简化对世界上一些最贫穷国家而言日益冗长和复杂的程序。【原文：Global financial leaders on Wednesday launched a blueprint for emerging-market debt restructurings, an effort to streamline a process that has grown increasingly lengthy and complex for some of the world’s poorest countries.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长维勒鲁瓦认为无通胀风险，称可能进一步降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，由于目前没有通胀风险，欧洲中央银行今年可能会进一步降低利率。【原文：The European Central Bank will probably lower interest rates further this year as there are currently no inflation risks, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 贝利警告贸易战将在英国央行预测前打击英国经济增长
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）警告说，尽管英国在关税方面享有优惠待遇，但由美国主导的贸易战仍将损害英国经济。此前，一项衡量私营部门活动的指标显示，唐纳德-特朗普总统的全球征税导致英国经济急剧下滑。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey warned that the US-led trade war would harm the UK economy despite preferential treatment on tariffs, after a gauge of private sector activity showed a steep drop due to President Donald Trump’s global levies.】

item.title: 库克斯说，德国总是愿意在 "困难时期 "花钱
item.description: 德国财政部长约尔格-库基斯（Joerg Kukies）说，德国从未在国家陷入困境时缩减开支。【原文：Germany never has held back on spending when the country was in trouble, Finance Minister Joerg Kukies said.】

item.title: 台积电尖端 A14 芯片技术将于 2028 年投产
item.description: 台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. plans to begin production with its A14 fabrication process in 2028, aiming to remain at the cutting edge of the chip industry.】

item.title: 印度称关税可能使经济增长减少半个百分点
item.description: 印度政府一位高级官员表示，美国对印度征收的关税可能会使印度的经济增长减少多达半个百分点。【原文：US tariffs on India could shave up to half a percentage point off the country’s economic growth, a top Indian government official said, adding that a more significant problem would be the global economy slumping.】

item.title: 贝莱德 iShares 加拿大主管在重组中离职
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份内部备忘录，贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc.’s head of iShares in Canada, Helen Hayes, has left the firm as part of a broader restructuring, according to an internal memo seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 贝尔德增加债券基金现金以抵御动荡
item.description: 贝尔德正在增加其市政债券基金的现金头寸，以应对本月关税引发的抛售。【原文：Baird is increasing cash positions within its municipal-bond funds in response to a tariff-induced selloff this month.】

item.title: 贝森特称日本会谈 "不寻求货币目标
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，特朗普政府在与日本的会谈中不会追求具体的汇率目标，而是重申其前任要求东京遵守七国集团长期承诺的呼吁。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the Trump administration won’t be pursuing specific exchange-rate targets in its talks with Japan, instead reiterating his predecessor’s calls for Tokyo to abide by long-standing Group of Seven commitments.】

item.title: 贸易担忧主导美联储《米色报告》，经济活动变化不大
item.description: 根据美联储《米色手册》（Beige Book）对各地区联络人的调查，最近几周，唐纳德-特朗普总统对美国贸易伙伴加征关税的不确定性在全国各地弥漫开来。【原文：Uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s heightened use of tariffs on US trading partners loomed large across the country in recent weeks, according to the Federal Reserve’s Beige Book survey of regional contacts.】

item.title: 非行称津巴布韦寻求 26 亿美元过桥融资以彻底解决债务问题
item.description: 非洲开发银行（African Development Bank）称，津巴布韦已提议寻求 26 亿美元的过桥融资，以帮助其清偿拖欠国际金融机构的债务，因为该国正试图打破可追溯到 1999 年的债务僵局。【原文：The African Development Bank said Zimbabwe has proposed seeking $2.6 billion in bridge finance to help it clear arrears owed to international financial institutions as it attempts to break a debt impasse dating back to 1999.】
